tkwatch
Class Utilities

java.lang.Object
  tkwatch.Utilities

final class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object

Contains some common routines used by the tkwatch package. Some of these were used only during development. Others appear for potential future use.

Contest version.

centerWindow

public static final void centerWindow(java.awt.Window window)
Centers a frame on the screen; from Murach and Steelman, Murach's Java SE 6, p. 487.

Parameters:
window - The window to center.

closeFrame

static final void closeFrame(javax.swing.JButton thisButton)
Called by a button to close the containing window when actions are done.

Parameters:
thisButton - The button that closes its containing window.

Parameters:

generateSignature

public static final java.lang.String generateSignature(java.lang.String data,
                                                       java.lang.String key)
                                                throws java.security.SignatureException
Generates the signature necessary to make a TradeKing API call. Adapted from the TradeKing API Reference Guide, 03.25.2011, p. 51.

Parameters:
data - Concatenation of the API request body and a timestamp.
key - The user's secret key.
Returns:
Returns the necessary signature.
Throws:
java.security.SignatureException - Thrown if the md5 hash-based message authentication code can't be generated.

getAccessTokens

public static final void getAccessTokens()
The Twitter OAuth authorization process requires access tokens. Twitter4j stores them in twitter4j.properties. Invoke this routine to obtain them; then add the appropriate lines in the properties file. (You will need to write your own main() to do this. This routine isn't actually called from the TKWatch+ routine. Documentation for twitter4j.properties is available here.

Adapted from Yusuke Yamamoto, OAuth support, April 18, 2011.

getConstraints

public static final java.awt.GridBagConstraints getConstraints(int gridx,
                                                               int gridy,
                                                               int gridwidth,
                                                               int gridheight,
                                                               int anchor)
Method for setting grid bag constraints; adapted from Murach and Steelman's Java SE 6, p. 542.

Parameters:
gridx - The leftmost cell that the component occupies.
gridy - The topmost cell that the component occupies.
gridwidth - The number of horizontal cells that a component occupies.
gridheight - The number of vertical cells that a component occupies.
anchor - Specifies the alignment of the component within the cell.

getDocumentBuilder

public static final javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilder getDocumentBuilder()
                                                                  throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
Gets a working instance of a document builder.

Returns:
The document builder instance.
Throws:
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException

getHtmlContent

public static final java.lang.String getHtmlContent(java.lang.String newUrlName)
Returns the content of a URL as a String instance. This was used only during development. Retained for completeness.

Parameters:
newUrlName - The name of the URL to visit.
Returns:
The contents of the URL as a String or null if there's a problem.

getQuitButton

public static final javax.swing.JButton getQuitButton()
Returns a quit button.

Returns:
A button that cleans up and exits.

getStatusPanel

public static final javax.swing.JPanel getStatusPanel()
Returns a standard panel for the bottom (SOUTH) of all windows.

getValueFromXml

public static final java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getValueFromXml(java.lang.String desiredElementName,
                                                                       java.lang.String xmlString)
Finds the value of the named element, if any, in an XML string. Adapted from Vohra and Vohra, Pro XML Development with Java Technology, p. 47.

Parameters:
desiredElementName - The name of the element to search for in the XML string.
xmlString - The XML string to search for an account number.
Returns:
Returns the element value(s) as formatted in the incoming string (if found) as a Vector, null otherwise.

informationMessage

public static final void informationMessage(java.lang.String messageText)
Shows an informational message and waits for user to clear it.

Parameters:
messageText - The message to be displayed.

prep

static final java.lang.String prep(java.lang.String inputString)
Prepares a string to be stored in an SQL statement. That means that single quoted (apostrophes) are doubled.

Parameters:
inputString - The string to prepared for SQL handling.
Returns:
The prepared string.

round2

static final double round2(double arg)
Returns the input argument, rounded to two decimal places.

Parameters:
arg - The argument to round.
Returns:
The argument rounded to two decimal places.

tradeKingRequest

public static final java.lang.String tradeKingRequest(java.lang.String resourceUrl,
                                                      java.lang.String body,
                                                      java.lang.String appKey,
                                                      java.lang.String userKey,
                                                      java.lang.String userSecret)
Issues a TradeKing API request. Adapted from the TradeKing API Reference Guide, 03.25.2011, p. 51.

Parameters:
resourceUrl - The URL to which API requests must be made.
body - The body of the API request.
appKey - The user's application key.
userKey - The user's key.
userSecret - The user's secret key.
Returns:
Returns the result of the API request.

unPrep

static final java.lang.String unPrep(java.lang.String inputString)
Prepares a retrieved string to be displayed without SQL-necessary doubled single quotes (apostrophes).

Parameters:
inputString - The string to be stripped of double apostrophes.
Returns:
The string ready for display.

Recursively travels through a DOM tree. Adapted from Vohra and Vohra, Pro XML Development with Java Technology, p. 47. This was used during development and is not called by TKWatch+. Retained for completeness.

Parameters:
previousNode -
visitNode -
